name: Paracetamol
description: Paracetamol is a commonly used pain reliever and fever reducer. It is often used to treat headaches, muscle aches, arthritis, backaches, toothaches, colds, and fevers.
benefit: Effective pain relief and fever reduction.
side_effect: Rare side effects include liver damage, skin rash, and allergic reactions.
alert: Do not exceed the recommended dosage. Consult a doctor if symptoms persist or worsen.

name: Ibuprofen
description: Ibuprofen is a nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID) used to relieve pain, reduce inflammation, and lower fever. It is commonly used to treat headaches, muscle aches, arthritis, menstrual cramps, and minor injuries.
benefit: Effective pain relief and anti-inflammatory properties.
side_effect: Common side effects include stomach upset, heartburn, and dizziness.
alert: Avoid taking on an empty stomach. Consult a doctor before long-term use.

name: Amoxicillin
description: Amoxicillin is a penicillin antibiotic used to treat a wide range of bacterial infections, including ear infections, sinus infections, urinary tract infections, and strep throat.
side_effect: Common side effects include nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, and rash.
alert: Finish the entire course of antibiotics as prescribed, even if symptoms improve.

name: Loratadine
description: Loratadine is an antihistamine used to relieve allergy symptoms such as sneezing, runny nose, itching, and watery eyes. It is also used to treat itching and redness caused by hives.
benefit: Relieves allergy symptoms without causing drowsiness in most people.
side_effect: Rare side effects include headache, dry mouth, and fatigue.
alert: Avoid driving or operating machinery if you experience drowsiness.

name: Omeprazole
description: Omeprazole is a proton pump inhibitor (PPI) used to reduce stomach acid production. It is commonly used to treat gastroesophageal reflux disease (GERD), ulcers, and heartburn.
benefit: Effective treatment for acid reflux and ulcers.
side_effect: Common side effects include headache, nausea, diarrhea, and stomach pain.
alert: Take the medication as directed by your doctor. Do not crush or chew delayed-release capsules.
